intro: Odontonema bracteolatum, commonly known as the Brazilian flame vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a climbing shrub that produces vibrant orange-red tubular flowers, which are attractive to hummingbirds and other pollinators. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often used in ornamental gardening. Its rapid growth and showy blooms make it a popular choice for vertical gardens and trellises.
